title: China, Japan officials agree to start talks on islands
description: Officials from both the Chinese and Japanese governments have agreed to hold bilateral talks to repair the ties damaged by the ongoing Diaoyu Islands dispute.
cleanContent: By Yu Runze, Sina EnglishOfficials from both the Chinese and Japanese governments have agreed to hold bilateral talks to repair the ties damaged by the ongoing Diaoyu Islands dispute.The Japanese Foreign Ministry made the announcement on Thursday that the two countries would meet in the near future to repair relations, only a day after Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda warned that if their dispute progressed in this manner, the whole Asian economy would suffer.The bilateral discussions will be held at the vice-ministerial level officials, but pre-discussion talks have to be held to decide when the meetings should take place.Luo Zhaohui, head of the Chinese Foreign Ministry's Asian Affairs Department, met his Japanese counterpart, Shinsuke Sugiyama on invitation to exchange views on Diaoyu Islands in Tokyo on Tursday.In an October 10th Interview, Japanese Prime Minister Noda said that theirs and Chinaâ€™s economies were the third and second largest economies, respectively, in the world, and their interdependence is only increasing. He said that if their relations continue to sour, both economies will suffer, and the rest of the world will be affected.																																																																								|  |
